intro: Lithocarpus rodgerianus, commonly known as the Philippine stone栎, is a member of the Fagaceae family, native to the Philippines. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its thick, fissured bark and elliptical, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by hard, woody nuts enclosed in a cupule. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests, often forming part of the understory vegetation. The species is valued for its durable timber and is also of interest in ecological studies due to its role in forest ecosystems.
